title: Senior Platform Engineer - SRE
content:
Wise is one the fastest growing companies in Europe and we’re on a mission to make money without borders the new normal. We’ve got 16 million customers across the globe and we’re growing. Fast.
Current banking systems don't let us send, spend or receive money across borders easily. Or quickly. Or cheaply. 
So, we’re building a new one.
And we’re looking for a Platform Engineer - SRE to join our team in London.
For our customers, using Wise should feel as simple as sending a text message. Yet behind our app and website lies a complex, one-of-a-kind engine of currencies and routes that’s being designed, built and powered by our talented teams in cities around the world. With new capabilities being built every day, there’s still a lot to figure out, and we can’t do it alone. This role is a unique opportunity to have an impact on Wise Mission, grow as a product leader and help save millions more people money.
The team you’ll be working with: SRE 
The SRE team’ mission is to focus on engineering-wide reliability problems at Wise. We set the reliability standard we expect of our hundreds of microservices to achieve, we do this via libraries, tooling, documentation, consulting and hands-on contribution.
As we scale we continue to push our teams to run autonomously. They are closest to our customers, so they’re empowered to decide what to prioritise and deliver, without being told what to do by leadership. This means they can move fast and run multiple projects at the same time.
At Wise we split our time between the office and home focusing on using the most appropriate place for our activities. Think about coming together in person for events which focus on coaching, community and collaboration.
Here’s how you’ll be contributing to the Team
You’ll be working with product and platform teams to tighten the loop between the two 
Identify potential reliability issues before they impact our customers
Measure our reliability to help teams make data-driven decisions
Is that you?
Experience of Incident Management and enjoy troubleshooting
Experience in implementing SRE principles, understand the differences between SLI/SLO/SLAs
Good Java knowledge, experience with relevant application frameworks e.g. Spring
Knowledge of architectural concepts such as microservices, service mesh
You’re passionate about helping others and keen to roll up your sleeves and take ownership to drive company-wide impact
Nice to Have
Experience of cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP)
Containerisation technology and orchestration platforms e.g. Docker, Kubernetes
Understanding and knowledge of different tiers of storage
Experience working in regulated business - PCI etc
Have experience of capacity planning as well as performance and load testing
Basic sysadmin skills in debugging issues with disk, network, app/JVM performance etc
What does success look like?
You’ll be building and maintaining the infrastructure and foundation of the technical parts of Wise
You’ll ensure we have our services up and running so product teams can work efficiently
You’ll understand our customers and the impact our product makes in their lives
You’ll have onboarded and found your place through understanding your team and tribe vision and how you can contribute
You’ll also have found your place in our mission and you understand our values and how they can guide you doing your best work
You help Wise achieve its mission by building on one of the key foundation technology layers at the heart of our platform.
What do we offer: 
Starting salary: £80,000-£115,000 + RSU
Numerous great benefits in our London office 
Key benefits:
Flexible working - whether it’s working from home, school plays or life admin we get that flexibility is essential and you’re trusted to do the right thing and be responsible
Paid annual holiday, sick days, parental leave and other leave opportunities
6 weeks of paid sabbatical after 4 years at Wise on top of annual leave
Interested? Find out more:
👀 How we work - a practical guide
📹 Engineering team blog
💻 Scaling our Infrastructure; how we make it work
💻 The Wise Tech Stack, 2022 edition
📈 Our Engineering career map
...or check out our Engineering blog.
 Salary (annual)£80,000—£115,000 GBPWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
